mdRecord.dcterms:title: North America: corrected from the observations communicated to the Royal Society at London, and the Royal Academy at Paris / By Iohn Senex, 1710 ; John Senex, sculpt
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Senex, John, -1740 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Senex is the only name recorded in the statement of responsibility, and F.R.S. is not present. (Senex was made a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1727.) [original]
Dedication: To the Honorable Anthony Hammond Esq. One of the Commissioners of Her Majties. Navy this Map is humbly dedicated and presented by his obliged servant. [original]
Decorative title cartouche in upper left corner, with coat of arms below it. Four scales in lower left corner. [original]
Shows boundaries, rivers, forests and principal settlements, with notes. [original]
Text passages include: "The Long River, or Dead River was discovered lately by the Baron Lahontan" ..." and "A lake of salt water ..." [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Area Table 7 1710 Senex: Imperfect, with stains and foxing; mounted on linen. Tracy W. McGregor Library, American History Collection. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Area Table 7 1710 Senex 1727: Later variant, with statement of responsibility "By Iohn Senex, F.R.S., 1710." Imperfect: Discolored, and broken at folds. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: North America--Maps--Early works to 1800
